intro: Chaetostoma canastrense, commonly known as the Canastrense armored catfish, is a species of catfish native to the freshwater regions of South America. It belongs to the family Loricariidae, characterized by its armored body and specialized mouth structure for grazing on algae and plant matter. The plant-like structures on its body, known as cirri, are used for sensing the environment and provide a camouflage effect in its habitat. This species is typically found in slow-moving rivers and streams with rocky substrates. Its botanical associations are primarily through its diet, which includes aquatic plants and algae.
